Text: To the choirmaster. According to The Dove on Far-off Terebinths. A Miktam of David, when the Philistines seized him in Gath.
Context: This title gives context to the emotional background of the Psalm, indicating a situation where David was under duress by his enemies.

Text: Be gracious to me, O God, for man has trampled me; all day long he oppresses me.
Context: The verse expresses David's plea for God’s mercy in a time of oppression by his enemies.

Text: My foes trample me all day long, for many proudly attack me.
Context: The intensity of David's plight is highlighted by the constant trampling and proud attacks by his many foes.

Text: When I am afraid, I put my trust in You.
Context: In the face of fear, David declares his trust in God, providing a contrasting emotional response to his fear.

Text: In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I will not fear. What can man do to me?
Context: David affirms his trust in God and questions the power of man compared to God's, emphasizing his choice not to fear.

Text: All day long they twist my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.
Context: David describes the deceit and hostile intentions of his enemies, which fuels his sense of injustice.

Text: They stir up strife, they lie in wait; they spy on my footsteps, eager to take my life.
Context: The verse depicts the extreme actions of his enemies, who are conspiring and actively seeking to harm David.

Text: By iniquity they escape; in your anger cast down the peoples, O God!
Context: David calls for God’s judgement on the peoples who have wronged him, expressing his desire for divine retribution.

Text: You have kept count of my tossings; put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not in Your book?
Context: David takes solace in the fact that God is aware of his suffering and has recorded all his tears and tribulations.

Text: Then my enemies will retreat on the day I call for help. By this I will know that God is for me.
Context: David expresses confidence that his enemies will be defeated when he calls on God, affirming his belief in God's support.

Text: In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise,
Context: David's trust in God is reinforced by his praise of God's word.

Text: in God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
Context: David reasserts his trust in God and his refusal to fear, questioning again the power of man over God's protection.

Text: I am bound by vows to You, O God; I will render thank offerings to You.
Context: David acknowledges his obligations and gratitude to God, promising to bring offerings in thanksgiving.

Text: For You have delivered my soul from death, and my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.
Context: David ends the Psalm with an expression of deep gratitude for God's deliverance from death and enabling him to live a godly life.
